cyclone.name: TAMMY
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northwest later today, cross or graze the northern Leeward Islands tonight-Saturday, then curve northward into the open Atlantic west of Bermuda.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watches: Guadeloupe; Antigua & Barbuda, Montserrat, St. Kitts & Nevis, Anguilla; St. Maarten; St. Martin & St. Barthelemy.  Tropical-storm Watches: Barbados, Martinique; Saba & St. Eustatius.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm Warnings: Dominica; Guadeloupe; Antigua & Barbuda, Montserrat, St. Kitts & Nevis, Anguilla; St. Maarten; St. Martin & St. Barthelemy.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Leeward Islands, northern Windward Islands, and later the U.S. & British Virgin Islands and eastern Puerto Rico.
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Yes – up to 4 inches possible in isolated spots
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: No – surge guidance 1-3 ft mainly for Leeward Islands; minimal for St. Croix
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts are possible Saturday night through Sunday; 34-kt wind chance peaks near 21%.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation less than 3 ft possible, mainly along north- and east-facing shores.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands may bring 1-2 inches with isolated totals near 4 inches, producing localized flash flooding and ponding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents on exposed beaches beginning late Friday and persisting through Sunday.
